title: The Uplifting Devotion of Ganga-mata Gosvamini | Sri Vasudev Keshav Dasa | Gaura Mandala Parikrama
speaker: HG Vasudev Keshav Dasa

segments.key_quote: So, we are at the Radha Govinda Temple and we saw the Radha Govinda deities in the center flanked by Chaitanya Mahaprabhu and Nithyananda Prabhu.
segments.summary: The speaker describes the deities present at the Radha Govinda Temple.

segments.key_quote: Mahabharata, Jagannatha and Ramayana stories are depicted here in these terracotta tiles.
segments.summary: The speaker describes the terracotta tiles depicting stories from Mahabharata, Ramayana, and Jagannatha, and introduces Sachi Devi.

segments.key_quote: Ganga Mata Goswamini was initiated in the line of Gauranga Shakti, Srila Gadadhar Pandit Goswami.
segments.summary: The speaker explains Ganga Mata Goswamini's position in the disciplic succession, tracing her lineage back to Gadadhar Pandit and describing the qualities of her guru, Haridas Pandit.

segments.key_quote: She is the only daughter of King of Puthiya, Princess Ganga Mata Sachi Devi.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces Ganga Mata Sachi Devi as a princess and explains how Sarvabhauma Bhattacharya's house became famous as Ganga Mata Mata in Puri.

segments.key_quote: Princess Sachi Devi was the daughter of King Naresh Narayanan. From her early childhood, Sachi Devi was indifferent to family life and was very devoted to Lord Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker narrates Sachi Devi's early life, her detachment from family life, her refusal to marry, and her subsequent pilgrimage and initiation by Sri Haridas Pandit Goswami.

segments.key_quote: After several years of such practice at Radha Kund, when Sachi had become very advanced in her devotional life, the Guru sent her to Purushottam Kshetra.
segments.summary: The speaker describes Sachi Devi's devotional practices at Radha Kund, her guru's instruction to go to Purushottam Kshetra, and her taking Kshetra Sanyasa and giving Diksha.

segments.key_quote: On the day of Ganga Sagara, she desired to bathe in the Ganges, she is in Puri. That night the Ganges came from the lotus feet of Lord Jagannath to her ashram and allowed her to bathe.
segments.summary: The speaker tells the story of Sachi Devi's desire to bathe in the Ganges while in Jagannathpuri and how the Ganges miraculously appeared to her.

segments.key_quote: Lord Jagannath, seeing this serious mistake, appeared in the dream to both the King and the head Pujari, ordering them to immediately release Sachi Devi from the jail and not only to release her, but to take Diksha from her.
segments.summary: The speaker narrates the events following Sachi Devi's miraculous bath, including her imprisonment, Lord Jagannath's intervention, and the King and head Pujari taking Diksha from her.

segments.key_quote: In the year 1721 AD in Sri Jagannathpuri, at the age of around 120 years, Ganga Mata Goswamini entered the eternal pastimes of Lord Shri Krishna and Jagannatha.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes the lecture by mentioning Ganga Mata Goswamini's passing and offers respects.
